Posts.Content: Nov 4, 2013 03:43PM RoseBuds wrote: lstewart51, good to hear you are home from your surgery and are feeling ok. I think it is a good thing we don't remember too much about these things. stay strong and rest. Iana830, sorry you have had such a long hard journey, I too would love to be able to say "make me a C" and it was all over in one go. Kathy
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2013 06:06AM RoseBuds wrote: Hi All I am to have delayed reconstruction done on Nov 8.  I originaly had my double mastectomy done in March 2011 and decided not to do any recon, but I am not happy with the end result.  I have very large con-caved areas on both sides of my chest and hanging bits under my arms.  I have tried all sorts of prosthetics from silicone to bath scrunchies but can not find anything that looks ok or is not to heavy or makes me sweat.  So after lots of thought I am having 800cc TE's put in both sides.  I have not decided what implants I will end up with as I am waiting to see how things will be after the TE's have been filled to the max.  I am hoping I will not need drains and that I will be ok to return to work within 2 weeks. Good Luck to all Kathy

Posts.Content: Nov 26, 2013 12:40PM RoseBuds wrote: I went for my check-up today. My PS is very pleased with my wounds they have healed very well. I was able to confirm that he had filled both my TE's with 50cc at the time of surgery and he filled another 50cc in each today. It was the first fill and I was very nervous but other than a slight pinch it was painless. My chest just feels a little tight now. I am to have 50cc fill every week until we decide its enough, then I am to have a short rest period then the exchange. Kathy
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2013 06:24AM RoseBuds wrote: mimi32, I am bothered by the cold making my chest muscle cramp up. It is very painful and it causes my whole body to be covered in goosebumps. I have tried to wrap up as much as I can but as soon as I step outside in the cold air it happens. Kathy

Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2013 06:46AM RoseBuds wrote: allebasi, I did not have any stitches I only had glue. I believe there are internal stitches but nothing on the outside. The glue I had came off over time when I was in the shower. Kathy

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2013 07:25AM RoseBuds wrote: Hi Everyone, good to read that everyone is doing well. I had my second fill this morning so I am now at 150cc each side. My skin is tight as I did delayed recon and was very concaved. Looking at my self now I look like I have AA cup on both sides. I have 750cc TE's so a long way to go to be done. We are doing 50cc each week and other than feeling a bit tight it does not hurt. Kathy
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Dec 7, 2013 05:23PM RoseBuds wrote: Teachingwithcancer, sorry to hear you have had such a bad time with infection and more surgery. Rest well and eat extra protein it will help you heal. Kathy
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Dec 10, 2013 11:39AM RoseBuds wrote: I just had my 3rd fill today. Had to travel in a snow storm to get it but I made it there and back ok. I am now at 200cc on each side but the right side looks smaller. My PS says it because of my chest wall and not to worry about it as all we are doing is stretching for now, final shape and projection will come with the implants. As I am a plus size and my TE's are for 750cc I still have a long way to go. Happy to report that other than a very tight feeling across my chest I am not in too much discomfort. I do take Tylenol and Advil just before I get the fill and then take Advil for the next 48 hours. I hope everyone who is having issues gets them resolved real soon. Kathy
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2013 07:39AM RoseBuds wrote: I am sleeping in my bed with extra pillows to prop me up. Getting out of bed is hard work but good for the tummy muscles! I have to sleep on my back as I can't lie on my side for now. So poor DH is having to listen to me snore, makes a change! Kathy
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 4, 2013 12:06PM RoseBuds wrote: I am having a Delayed reconstuction, I had my BMX back in 2011, so this time its just the TE getting inserted and some tidy up under the arms.  I was hoping to not have drains again but after talking to my PS this morning he is going to use drains after all... Stripping the drains is just holding the drain tube between thumb and finger and gently sliding down the tube, this helps to keep the drain tube free of deposits and not get blocked.  I only did mine when I could see there was deposits building up.  I only had my drains for about 6 days when I had my BMX so I am hoping for about the same ths time. Kathy
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2013 06:26AM RoseBuds wrote: I did not sleep last night, can't believe I am so worried about this surgery. I just wish tomorrow was here. Kathy
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2013 03:32AM RoseBuds wrote: morning everyone, yesterday was an odd day, the pain was not to unbearable just certain ways I move it catches me. I was able to take a shower and it was bliss to let the warm water run down my back it soothed the muscles. My skin is hyper sensitive in my chest area so it feels very strange to touch. I am having to wear a surgical bra and I think that is not helping with comfort. seaniebopp, it's easy to be scared of the unknown I tried to look on my surgery as a way of answering all the questions, was there more cancer? Did it spread? It's only after the surgery that you will know for sure. Please tell your sons they will want to help you, let them be strong for you. gtgirl, good luck with your surgery, having a blood issue to deal with as well as all this makes it hard. Finding out all the options available is a great thing and I found the ladies here to be so supportive I found out so much just from reading. Nancyjean1967, I hear you about the constipation... It's the worst, I have had to double my water intake and I have been popping stool softeners as well. I am going to go for a walk today to see if that will help get things moving. Kathy
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 12, 2013 10:13AM RoseBuds wrote: when I was first diagnosed back in 2011 I thought I would never get over the fear that I lived with every minute of every day, my mind was full of what if's and why me! I would be fine one minute and the next I was a weeping mess. Over time my fears changed some were more real as in the fear when I had surgery and other not so real like lying awake being fearful of what other will think if I give up this fight and not be brave and strong as everyone kept telling me. Now it's 2013 and I can't remember where or when I left those fears all I know is I don't live in fear everyday. I do have times when I have to go for a check-up that I worry about something showing up but that is not a fear just normal worry. Hang in there it will become easier you are allowed to be fearful and you are allowed to not be strong. Kathy

I am going for my next visit to see my PS on Tuesday and I must ask him why he filled my left TE with more then the right one, looks very odd. Kathy

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2013 12:03PM RoseBuds wrote: When I had my BMX in 2011 I went home the same day.  They said as I was not having any reconstruction there was no need for me to stay overnight.  I do not even remember the ride home or going upstairs.  First thing I remember is waking up propped up in my bed.  I did have a visiting nurse call everyday until my drains were ready to be removed 10 days later. I am hoping this time I will be a bit more awake for the trip home, but again I will just be day surgery. Kathy

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2013 07:20AM RoseBuds wrote: Hi all, I am home from the hospital and happy to report everything went well. The TE,s are in and have 100cc in each so for the first time in 2 years I no longer has a concaved chest and my PS has taken away the dog ears from under my arms. He has me in a surgical bra that I can take off to shower but have to keep on until my follow up appointment. I am also very happy that he did not use any drains. I am not good with taking narcotic pain meds so I am just on Tylenol and antibiotics.. Kathy
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 10, 2013 03:35AM RoseBuds wrote: TessaW you are going to need someone to help you even if its just for a day or two, when I had my BMX i could just about get out of the chair without help but that was it for days and I needed help with the drains. Do you have family that could come and help? mmimi68 Good to hear you are doing ok, I know how tired I get from the slightest amount of effort, I think it is our bodies making sure we rest. I am doing ok. my chest feels tight this morning but I am hoping that after a warm shower and some gentle shoulder exercises will help, I have to wait until DH is up before I venture into the shower. I am just taking Tylenol for pain as I dont like narcotic they make me feel very sick. I am still having to wear the surgical bra which is very tight as well so thats not helping. Kathy
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2013 05:40PM RoseBuds wrote: just wanted to say hi to all the new people, I hope your surgery goes well. I am recovering nicely from having my TE's placed. Now some of my swelling has gone I can see that there is more fluid in my left TE than the right, not sure why my PS has done that but I will ask at my follow up. I am still having to wear the surgical bra that they put on at the time of the surgery but it is starting to get a bit smelly so I am going to leave it off when I have my shower in the morning and give it a quick wash. I do have a sports bra that is quite firm so I am hoping it will be ok. Kathy
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 29, 2013 02:13PM RoseBuds wrote: I too have been bothered with ultra sensitive skin across my chest. The only way I can describe it is it's like bad sunburn and wearing something rough. It gets worse as the day goes on, placing my hand on the skin helps for a while but it comes back. It get worse if I get cold. When I spoke to my PS he said it is the nerve endings healing and it will pass in time. Kathy
